About the app

This web interface is designed to help users identify the sufficient number of cells to use in their sc-RNA seq experiment. The application interactively interrogates deposited single cell datasets and down-samples them into smaller subsets having 20%, 40%, 60%, 80% and 100% of the parent dataset, respectively. A complete analysis is run on each subset and the results will be displayed. Depending on the type of analysis, (i.e. integrated vs single analysis), results are grouped into five possible categories; clustering solutions, variable genes, marker genes, conserved marker genes, and differentially expressed (DE) genes. A score will be assigned to each clustering solution relatively to the parent dataset. The degree of overlap between the result set of each subset and the parent dataset will also be identified. Please selecet "Load Example 10K PBMC Data" for a worked example.

To help in the identification of a suitable subset size, the following criteria can be used:

1) Subsets resulting in a high marginal increase of the NMI/ARI score.

2) Subsets whose identified marker genes and/or DE genes have a high degree of overlap with the full dataset.

3) Subsets that can sufficiently resolve genes of specific biological interest in a given dataset.

Usage

Users can upload single or paired datasets; for each dataset, a matrix.mtx, genes.tsv/features.tsv and barcodes.tsv files will be accepted (output from a Cell Ranger run). For each dataset, all three files must be uploaded together. The pattern of the mitochondrial genes should be specified e.g. use "^MT-" for human datasets and "^mt-" for mouse datasets, etc. The desired resolution should also be selected; lower resolutions, however might not clearly resolve the differences between each subset. The default resolution is set to 0.5. By default, only the top 5 most significant genes within each cluster are used for resolving marker and DE genes. This can be increased better power but would increase computation time. For a single dataset consisting of 10K cells, the analysis could take ~20 minutes. The same is true for an integrated dataset of 10K cells. Computation of conserved marker genes for integrated datasets is optional and could add an extra hour to the analysis.

Results

Clustering solutions

For each subset, clustering solutions will be computed and projected using UMAP projections. Normalized mutual information (NMI) and adjusted Rand index (ARI) will be used to score these clustering solutions against the full dataset. Results represent the degree of similarity of cell labells in each subset when compared to the parent dataset. Scores closer to 1 have higher similarity to the parent dataset.

Variable genes

For each subset, the top 10 most variable genes will be plotted. This analysis is not applicable for integrated datasets.

Marker genes, conserved marker genes, and differentially expressed genes

These sets of genes are identified for each subset as per Seurat’s analysis pipeline. An UpSet plot will summarise i) the number of genes per subset and ii) the number of overlapping genes. Identified marker/DE genes will be listed in a table where their presence (indicated by “1”) or absence (indicated by “0”) from a particular subset will be noted. Summary statistics for each gene per subset will also computed and displayed.

*DE genes and conserved marker genes are only identified for integrated datasets.
